abstract: On Thursday, Apple C.E.O. Steven P. Jobs acknowledged that the company had abused its core customers’ trust and extended a $100 store credit to the early iPhone buyers.
snippet: On Thursday, Apple C.E.O. Steven P. Jobs acknowledged that the company had abused its core customers’ trust and extended a $100 store credit to the early iPhone buyers.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 6 — In June, they were calling it the God Phone. On Thursday, it was the Chump Phone.

headline.main: IPhone Owners Crying Foul Over Price Cut
headline.print_headline: IPhone Owners Crying Foul Over Price Cut

byline.original: By Katie Hafner and Brad Stone

abstract: Apple wants to sell lots of iPhones this Christmas before its rivals catch up. Lower prices will help the company “go for it,” as Mr. Jobs put it.
snippet: Apple wants to sell lots of iPhones this Christmas before its rivals catch up. Lower prices will help the company “go for it,” as Mr. Jobs put it.
lead_paragraph: I hate to say it, but I think Steve Jobs is telling the truth about the iPhone price cut.

headline.main: Steve Jobs Speaks the Truth About the iPhone Price Drop

abstract: A little consumer advice for iPhone buyers who feel like chumps.
snippet: A little consumer advice for iPhone buyers who feel like chumps.
lead_paragraph: While iPhone owners wait for Apple to give out more details about the $100 credit it is offering to those who bought an iPhone before Wednesday’s $200 price reduction, they might want to consider their other options.

headline.main: Refunds and Credits for iPhone Owners
